alert.note: Alert for Eastern Rutland; Eastern Windsor; Western Rutland; Western Windsor (Vermont) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Burlington (Northern Vermont and New York)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 07 at 7:52PM EDT by NWS Burlington
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Rutland and southwestern Windsor Counties through 845 PM EDT... At 751 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Mount Tabor, moving northeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Chester, Woodstock, Mount Holly, Ludlow, Cavendish, Mount Tabor, Andover, Weston, Ludlow Village, Perkinsville Village, Mt. Holly, Mt. Tabor, Reading, Baltimore, Springfield, Weathersfield, West Windsor, Danby, Plymouth, and Windsor. This includes Interstate 91 between mile markers 40 and 51. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.

area.areaDesc: Eastern Rutland; Eastern Windsor; Western Rutland; Western Windsor
